esta bueno pero.... es mejor la version HD

I got this game during the Steam Summer Sale of 2018 or 19, and left it sitting in my library in favor of the two Portal games, and then other games got into the way. I got back to the game this year, and with 14 hours of gameplay, I can say it was, most definitively, worth my money.

The game utilises compact maps, making the game twist and turn to streamline it as much as possible. It is worth the money to buy it when there is not a sale, but I suggest waiting for one, as I got it for around US$0.25

The downside is the graphics, but there are shaders and retextures you can download online to fix that if you even want to. 10/10 would recommend.

If you're going to play the original Half-Life, play the [i]original[/i] Half-Life. Half-Life Source is a half-measure that updates a few things but leaves the game largely untouched, so you have blocky 1998 character models and props with super realistic smoke and water effects and the result is just incongruous. The updated light and shadows sounds like a good idea on paper, but given how blocky and angular the models and rooms are the shadows make everything look way more stark and overly dark. The added ragdoll physics is neat, but you can't gib enemies with the crowbar anymore which is small, but it's always been a part of the fun of the original, More seriously, there are lots of random bugs that weren't present in the orignal, so even if you like the meager visual updates, this is still worse.

Half-Life should be played on the original GoldSrc engine. This source port is glitchy, glossy, and many before me have gone deeper into why HL doesn't work in a newer engine. It's like if id Software re-released Quake onto id Tech 4 without any further modifications.
very good game

It's a worse version of the original GoldSrc Half-Life. Every texture has a gross chrome shine to it, the lighting is inconsistent, looking better in some places and worse in others. Gordon moves slightly faster and jumps slightly higher, making certain segments (like the cliff where the funny valve song plays) more difficult. The enemy AI is atrocious. Houndeyes and the HECU were especially butchered. Barnacle tongues don't render properly, so I got grabbed more often, thinking nothing was there. The tentacle monsters in Blast Pit, Surface Tension, and Interloper are all perfectly harmless, making their segments boring. The skyboxes are broken on certain chapters, most notably outside the warehouse in Surface Tension. Residue Processing is borderline unplayable because of all the visual glitches blocking your view. It's a crime that this game costs as much as the original. Get this game for the gmod assets if you want, but never do a serious playthough.
Half-Life: Source
